trans-unit.source: Again i hope this solution can help some-one.
trans-unit.target: 我再次希望这个解决方案能帮助到某人。

trans-unit.source: All answers here are doing some kind of string splitting using recursion, CTEs, multiple CHARINDEX, REVERSE and PATINDEX, inventing functions, call for CLR methods, number tables, CROSS APPLYs ... Most answers cover many lines of code.
trans-unit.target: 这里的所有答案都使用递归， CTE ，多个 CHARINDEX ， REVERSE 和 PATINDEX 进行某种字符串拆分，发明了功能，要求CLR方法，数字表， CROSS APPLY …多数答案涵盖了许多行代码。

trans-unit.source: Almost all the other answers are replacing the string being split which wastes CPU cycles and performs unnecessary memory allocations.
trans-unit.target: 几乎所有其他的答案都是替换被拆分的字符串,这样会浪费CPU周期,并执行不必要的内存分配。

trans-unit.source: And the result-set is:

trans-unit.source: And you call the function like this :
trans-unit.target: 而你这样调用这个函数。

trans-unit.source: But - if you really want nothing more than an approach to get the nth element - this can be done as real one-liner, no UDF, not even a sub-select... And as an extra benefit: type safe
trans-unit.target: 但是-如果您真的只想获取第n个元素的方法 -可以将其作为真正的单行代码，无UDF，甚至不包括子选择来完成...还有一个额外的好处：输入安全

trans-unit.source: How do I split a string so I can access item x

trans-unit.source: I cover a much better way to do a string split here: http://www.digitalruby.com/split-string-sql-server/
trans-unit.target: 我在这里介绍了一种更好的方法来拆分字符串：http : //www.digitalruby.com/split-string-sql-server/

trans-unit.source: I devoloped this,
trans-unit.target: 这是我设计的。

trans-unit.source: I don't believe SQL Server has a built-in split function, so other than a UDF, the only other answer I know is to hijack the PARSENAME function:
trans-unit.target: 我不相信SQL Server有内置的Split函数,所以除了UDF之外,我知道的唯一答案就是劫持PARSENAME函数。

trans-unit.source: I know it's an old Question, but i think some one can benefit from my solution.
trans-unit.target: 我知道这是一个老问题,但我认为有人可以从我的解决方案中受益。

trans-unit.source: I modified it and I'm using select with union all and it works
trans-unit.target: 我修改了它，并且将 select 与 union all 使用，并且可以正常工作

trans-unit.source: I use the answer of frederic but this did not work in SQL Server 2005
trans-unit.target: 我使用了frederic的答案,但这在SQL Server 2005中不起作用。

trans-unit.source: I was looking for the solution on net and the below works for me. Ref.
trans-unit.target: 我一直在寻找在线解决方案，以下内容对我来说很有用。 参考。

trans-unit.source: If you need to support arbitrary strings (with xml special characters)
trans-unit.target: 如果你需要支持任意字符串(带xml特殊字符)。

trans-unit.source: If your database has compatibility level of 130 or higher then you can use the STRING_SPLIT function along with OFFSET FETCH clauses to get the specific item by index.
trans-unit.target: 如果您的数据库具有130或更高的兼容性级别，则可以使用STRING_SPLIT函数以及OFFSET FETCH子句按索引获取特定项。

trans-unit.source: If your string might include forbidden characters (especially one among &><), you still can do it this way. Just use FOR XML PATH on your string first to replace all forbidden characters with the fitting escape sequence implicitly.
trans-unit.target: 如果您的字符串可能包含禁止的字符（尤其是 &>< 之中的一个），您仍然可以通过这种方式进行操作。只需先在字符串上使用 FOR XML PATH ，即可用适合的转义序列隐式替换所有禁止的字符。

trans-unit.source: In this post I tested various approaches and found, that OPENJSON is really fast. Even much faster than the famous "delimitedSplit8k()" method...
trans-unit.target: 在这篇文章中，我测试了各种方法，发现 OPENJSON 确实非常快。甚至比著名的“ delimitedSplit8k（）”方法要快得多。

trans-unit.source: In my opinion you guys are making it way too complicated. Just create a CLR UDF and be done with it.
trans-unit.target: 在我看来,你们把它弄得太复杂了。只要创建一个CLR UDF就可以了。

trans-unit.source: It separates all the 3 sub-strings deliminator by ' '.
trans-unit.target: 它用''''分隔了所有3个子字符串的分界符。

trans-unit.source: It's a very special case if - additionally - your delimiter is the semicolon. In this case I replace the delimiter first to '#DLMT#', and replace this to the XML tags finally:
trans-unit.target: 这是一个非常特殊的情况，如果-另外- 您的分隔符是分号。在这种情况下，我首先将定界符替换为“＃DLMT＃”，最后将其替换为XML标签：

trans-unit.source: Let some table with identifiers like
trans-unit.target: 让一些带有标识符的表,如

trans-unit.source: More on split functions, why (and proof that) while loops and recursive CTEs don't scale, and better alternatives, if splitting strings coming from the application layer:
trans-unit.target: 更多关于拆分函数,为什么(和证明),而循环和递归CTEs不扩展,以及更好的替代方案,如果拆分来自应用层的字符串。

trans-unit.source: More on splitting lists : custom delimiters, preventing duplicates, and maintaining order
trans-unit.target: 关于拆分列表的更多信息:自定义分隔符、防止重复和维护顺序的问题。

trans-unit.source: Most of the solutions here use while loops or recursive CTEs. A set-based approach will be superior, I promise, if you can use a delimiter other than a space:
trans-unit.target: 这里的大多数解决方案都使用了while循环或递归CTE。我保证,如果你能使用空格以外的分隔符,基于集的方法会更有优势。

trans-unit.source: No need to Pivot as all the resultant sub-string will be displayed in one Row
trans-unit.target: 不需要Pivot,因为所有结果的子字符串将显示在一行中。

trans-unit.source: Obvious problem is when the string already contains a period. I still think using a UDF is the best way...any other suggestions?
trans-unit.target: 很明显的问题是当字符串中已经包含句号的时候。我仍然认为使用UDF是最好的方法...........还有其他建议吗?

trans-unit.source: Of course you can use variables for delimiter and position (use sql:column to retrieve the position directly from a query's value):
trans-unit.target: 当然，您可以将变量用于定界符和位置（使用 sql:column 直接从查询的值中检索位置）：

trans-unit.source: On SQL Server 2016 or above, though, you should look at STRING_SPLIT() and STRING_AGG():
trans-unit.target: 但是，在SQL Server 2016或更高版本上，您应该查看 STRING_SPLIT() 和 STRING_AGG() ：

trans-unit.source: One must know the total no. of spaces (sub-string).
trans-unit.target: 必须知道总的空格数(子字符串)。

trans-unit.source: One must not use while loop, as it decreases the performance.
trans-unit.target: 一、不要在循环时使用,否则会降低性能。

trans-unit.source: PARSENAME takes a string and splits it on the period character. It takes a number as its second argument, and that number specifies which segment of the string to return (working from back to front).
trans-unit.target: PARSENAME接收一个字符串,并将其分割成句号。它取一个数字作为第二个参数,这个数字指定了要返回字符串的哪一段(从后到前)。

trans-unit.source: Performance Surprises and Assumptions : STRING_SPLIT()
trans-unit.target: 性能惊喜和假设。STRING_SPLIT()

trans-unit.source: Performance here is not amazing, but calling a function over a million row table is not the best idea. If performing a string split over many rows I would avoid the function.
trans-unit.target: 这里的性能并不惊人,但调用一个超过百万行表的函数并不是最好的主意。如果执行一个字符串拆分多行的函数,我会避开这个函数。

trans-unit.source: Please help with STRING_SPLIT improvements
trans-unit.target: 请帮助进行STRING_SPLIT改进。

trans-unit.source: Previous version would fail for input string longer than 4000 chars. This version takes care of the limitation:
trans-unit.target: 以前的版本会对输入字符串超过4000个字符时失效。这个版本解决了这个限制。

trans-unit.target: 使用带有递归 CTE 的 TVF 的基于纯集的解决方案。您可以将此函数 JOIN 并 APPLY 到任何数据集。

trans-unit.target: 遗憾的是，开发人员忘了用 STRING_SPLIT 返回部件的索引。但是，使用SQL Server 2016+，有 JSON_VALUE 和 OPENJSON 。

trans-unit.source: When OPENJSON parses a JSON array, the function returns the indexes of the elements in the JSON text as keys.
trans-unit.target: 当OPENJSON解析一个JSON数组时,函数返回JSON文本中元素的索引作为键。

trans-unit.source: With JSON_VALUE we can pass in the position as the index' array.

trans-unit.target: 然而,另一个通过delimeter函数得到字符串的第n'th部分。

trans-unit.source: You can leverage a Number table to do the string parsing.
trans-unit.target: 你可以利用数字表来进行字符串解析。

trans-unit.source: You can split a string in SQL without needing a function:
trans-unit.target: 你可以在SQL中分割一个字符串,而不需要函数。

trans-unit.source: You can use this simple logic:
trans-unit.target: 你可以使用这个简单的逻辑。

trans-unit.source: You can't do this with just the native STRING_SPLIT function added in SQL Server 2016, because there is no guarantee that the output will be rendered in the order of the original list. In other words, if you pass in 3,6,1 the result will likely be in that order, but it could be 1,3,6. I have asked for the community's help in improving the built-in function here:
trans-unit.target: 您不能仅通过在SQL Server 2016中添加本机 STRING_SPLIT 函数来执行此操作，因为不能保证输出将按照原始列表的顺序进行呈现。换句话说，如果您传入 3,6,1 ,则结果可能会按照该顺序进行，但可能是 1,3,6 。我在这里要求社区的帮助来改善内置功能：

trans-unit.source: You could also add the idx you want as an argument to the function, but I'll leave that as an exercise to the reader.
trans-unit.target: 您也可以将所需的 idx 添加为函数的参数，但我将其作为练习留给读者。

trans-unit.target: 您可能会发现SQL用户定义函数中解析带分隔符的字符串的解决方案很有用（来自The Code Project）。

trans-unit.source: building on @NothingsImpossible solution, or, rather, comment on the most voted answer (just below the accepted one), i found the following quick-and-dirty solution fulfill my own needs - it has a benefit of being solely within SQL domain.
trans-unit.target: 建立在@NothingsImpossible解决方案的基础上，或者说是对投票最多的答案（仅在公认的答案以下）发表评论，我发现以下快速而又肮脏的解决方案可以满足我自己的需求-它具有完全位于SQL域中的优势。

trans-unit.source: cleanup
trans-unit.target: cleanup

trans-unit.source: given a string "first;second;third;fourth;fifth", say, I want to get the third token. this works only if we know how many tokens the string is going to have - in this case it's 5. so my way of action is to chop the last two tokens away (inner query), and then to chop the first two tokens away (outer query)
trans-unit.target: 给出一个字符串 "第一;第二;第三;第四;第五",比如说,我想得到第三个令牌。

trans-unit.source: i know that this is ugly and covers the specific conditions i was in, but am posting it just in case somebody finds it useful. cheers
trans-unit.target: 我知道这是丑陋的,涵盖了我在的具体条件,但发布它只是为了防止有人发现它有用。

trans-unit.source: note FIELD, INDEX and TYPE.
trans-unit.target: 注意FIELD，INDEX和TYPE。

trans-unit.target: 9时20分跑出

trans-unit.source: while similar to the xml based answer by josejuan, i found that processing the xml path only once, then pivoting was moderately more efficient:
trans-unit.target: 虽然与josejuan的答案类似,但我发现,只处理一次xml路径,然后透视的效率适中。
